content: On June 20, 1979, the Atlanta Braves faced the Philadelphia Phillies in a thrilling game that ended in a 9-8 victory for the Braves. The highlight of the game was a dramatic two-run homer hit by future Hall of Famer Hank Aaron, marking the 751st home run of his illustrious career. This game was part of Aaron's final season in Major League Baseball, making the moment particularly memorable for Braves fans as they celebrated one of the greatest hitters in the game.
